result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samantha M Guthman

records.addlTxt: Order to discharge Attorney
9/7/22 Paid Attorney fees via CC.  Copy to finance-lg

1:57 PM Defendant Samantha M Guthman appeared by video.  Attorney Terry L. Nussberger appeared by video for Samantha M Guthman.  DA Ellen Anderson appeared via Zoom.   All cases 21CF259, 22CF6, 22CM7 heard at the same time.    Plea/Sentencing set on all three cases.   DA recited plea agreement.  Attorney Nussberrger will guarantee the payment due to the treasurer's office.     Court reviewed documents on file.   Court addressed DE as to video appearance.   DE waived her personal appearance.   Court reviewed plea colloquy with DE.  DE understands her rights and reviewed the plea questionnaire with her attorney.   
21CF259:  Ct 1 Poss of Meth on or near certain premises (felony).  Parties agree to a 2 year deferred.  Upon successful completion Ct 1 is dismissed.   Court deferred finding of Guilt on 21CF259 on Ct 1 for 2 years.   
DE entered a G plea.  A misdemeanor offense.  State reviewed conditions of deferred agreement.  bond continues.  
22CF6:  Ct 1 amended to Poss of Amphetamine.   DE entered a G plea.  CT 2 Bail jumping:  DE entered a plea of G.  Both misdemeanor offenses.    Court found DE guilty of both counts.    Maximum penalties cited.     S/W.  Court placed DE on 2 years probation. Court informed DE to contact probation office asap.   Court sited conditions of probation as noted on documents on file with the Court.   DNA sample, surcharge and court costs ordered.   
22CM7:  Dism. R/I. 
All others charges not plead to are dismissed but R/I.
Attorney Nussberger informed Court he reviewed plea agreement with DE and stated DE understands penalty and charges.   
Attorney Nussberger stipulated to CC and that there is a factual basis for plea.   Court finds factual basis and accepted pleas.  
Attorney Nussberger made argument as to sentence.  
DE informed to notify clerk w/in 48 hours of a change of address and/or phone number.
Adj. 2:22 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:17 PM Defendant Samantha M Guthman appeared by video.  Attorney Terry L. Nussberger appeared by video for Samantha M Guthman.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 21CF259, 22CF6, 22CM7.  Time set for PH in 21CF259 and 22CF6-DE/Atty will waive PH in both cases.  State would like it put on the record that Atty has a potential conflict. Atty Nussberger explains the potential conflict to the court.  DE will waive any potential conflict with this matter.  Court instructs on waiver of PH, DE makes waiver knowingly, freely and voluntarily. Court will accept waiver of PH in each CF case.  Set for Arrign in CF cases, Status in CM case. Set for October 3, @ 10:30am.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
CHANGE OF PHONE NUMBER
Review hearing on August 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Review hearing on August 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
